API Documentation¶

mtc.py¶

mtc.py

Author: Tyrice Clark Company: Civic Resource Group Email: tyricec@civicresourcegroup.com

This module is used to import one day of data into piwik.

mtc.archive_logs(zip_file, config)[source]¶

Main function to archive logs.

Parameters:
zip_file (string):
Zip file that contains all logs to archive.
config (dict):
Dictionary containing configuration values.
mtc.cleanup(config)[source]¶

Cleans up directories and files that were created from script.

Parameters:
config (dict):
Dictionary containing configuration values.
mtc.compress_logs(logs, config)[source]¶

Main function for compressing logs for upload.

Parameters:
logs (list):
List of log files to be compressed.
config (dict):
Dictionary that contains configuration values.
Return type:
string
Returns:
The name of the zip file to upload to Amazon bucket.
mtc.create_zip_objs(zips, config)[source]¶

Create zip objects from list of files passed.

Parameters:
zips (list):
List of zip files to become ZipFile objects.
config (dict):
Dictionary with configuration values.
Return type:
list
Returns:
A list of ZipFile objects.
mtc.download_cb(received, total)[source]¶

Callback function for s3 downloads.

Parameters:
recieved (str):
Number of bytes currently downloaded.
total (str):
Total number of bytes of file being downloaded.
mtc.download_log(key, config)[source]¶

Downloads file from s3 bucket to file system.

Parameters:
key (boto.s3.key.Key):
Key to download.
config (dict):
Dictionary with configuration values.
Return type:
tuple
Returns:
Result tuple with format: (key_name, status, time, key_date)

list

mtc.extract_log(key_name, log, zip_obj, config)[source]¶

Extracts log from zip file.

Parameters:
key_name (str):
Name of file downloaded.
log (str):
Name of file to extract from zip
zip_obj (tuple):
Tuple with format:
(Zip Object, Number for zip file, Number for log file)
config (dict):
Dictionary with configuration values.
Return type:
tuple
Returns:
Tuple with format:
(key_name, extract_file_name)
mtc.filter_keys(keys, search, config)[source]¶

Filters keys based off it’s site regular expression pattern.

Parameters:
keys (list):
List of keys to filter.
search (re):
Regular expression to match for filter.
config (dict):
Dictionary with configuration values.
Return type:
list
Returns:
List of keys that are matched by regex pattern.
mtc.filter_logs_by_date(log_files, config)[source]¶

Filters log files that match date passed to script. Matches against #Date column with log files.

Parameters:
log_files (list):
List of log files to filter.
config (dict):
Dictionary with configuration values.
Return type:
list
Returns:
A list of files that match date.

mtc.get_error(stderr)[source]¶

Reads in error stream and returns output result.

Parameters:
stderr (IO):
Error stream to read.
Return type:
tuple
Returns:
Result tuple that is either output of error or skip parameter to retry. Format: (“output”, “error_output”), (“skip”, “skip number”)

Main function of script.

mtc.run_archive(config)[source]¶

Runs piwik archive command.

Parameters:
config (dict):
Dictionary with configuration values.
mtc.run_import(log, config, skip=None)[source]¶

Runs import on log passed.

Parameters:
log (str):
Name of log to import.
config (dict):
Dictionary containing configuration values.
skip (str) (optional):
Value to retry import at previous line number
Return type:
tuple
Returns:
Result tuple. Format: (True,), (“output”, “error output”), (“skip”, “skip value”)
mtc.run_piwik_command(command)[source]¶

Runs piwik import command.

Parameters:
command (str):
Command to run.
Return type:
tuple
Returns:
Result tuple of command. Format: (True,), (“output”, “error output”), (“skip”, “skip number”)
mtc.run_script(domain, script_date)[source]¶

Runs all main functions for specific domain and date.

Name of domain that script is running for.
config (dict):
Dictionary that holds configuration of script.
mtc.setup_script(domain, script_date)[source]¶

Sets up everything needed for script to run.

mtc.unzip_log(key_name, zip_obj, num, config, key_date)[source]¶

Unzip logs from zip file passed.

Parameters:
key_name (str):
Name of zip file.
zip_obj (ZipFile):
ZipFile object to extract from.
num (int):
Number assigned to zip file.
config (dict):
Dictionary with configuration values.
key_date (str):
Date of key from Leidos.
Return type:
list
Returns:
A list of results containing extracted logs.

List of files to unzip.

Dictionary with configuration values.
Return type:
list
Returns:
List of results with extracted name added.

Bucket to upload zip file to.

Dictionary containing configuration values.

mtc_helpers.py¶

mtc_helpers.py

Author: Tyrice Clark Company: Civic Resource Group Email: tyricec@civicresourcegroup.com

This module has all the helper functions needed for the main script, mtc.py

mtc_helpers.create_date_range(start_date, end_date)[source]¶

Creates a date range list.

Parameters:
start_date (str):
Date string to become datetime object
end_date (str):
Date string to become datetime object
Return type:
list
Returns:
A list containing datetime objects of start and end date.
mtc_helpers.escape_slashes(word)[source]¶

Replaces slashes within a word with a hypen.

Parameters:
word (str):
Word to escape slashes from.
Return type:
str
Returns:
Word with slashes escaped.
mtc_helpers.get_bucket(conn, bucket_name)[source]¶

Gets bucket from s3 connection.

Parameters:

Connection to s3 machine.
bucket_name (str):
Name of bucket to get.
Return type:
boto.s3.bucket.Bucket
Returns:
Bucket from s3 machine.
mtc_helpers.get_connection(access_key, secret)[source]¶

Gets connection to S3.

Parameters:
access_key:
Access key needed for s3 connection.
secret:
Secret key needed for s3 connection.
Return type:
boto.s3.connection
Returns:
A connection to the s3 machine.
mtc_helpers.get_credentials(config, access_name)[source]¶

Get Credentials for either downloading or uploading.

Parameters:
config (dict):
Dictionary with configuration values.
access_name (str):
Name of credentials. Value can be either “push” or “pull”.
Return type:
tuple
Returns:
A tuple with access key and secret key.

Gets current working directory of script.

Return type:
str
Returns:
Current working directory of script.
mtc_helpers.get_date_in_log(log)[source]¶

Finds the date within the log file. Can be found on line 3 of each valid log file.

Parameters:
log (tuple):
Log tuple that comes from results of download and unzip functions.
Return type:
str
Returns:
Date from the log.

Parameters:

Bucket to get keys from.
Return type:
list
Returns:
List of keys from bucket.
mtc_helpers.get_result(process, key_date, *args)[source]¶

Returns result from process.

Used to reduce try, except, blocks in functions.

Parameters:
process (method):
function that processes arguments to a result.
date (str):
date of key that is part of the result.
*args:
Arguments for process method.
Return type:
tuple
Returns:
Result tuple from process.

Gets the regex pattern for a domain.

Parameters:
domain (str):
Domain to get log regex matching for.
Return type:
str
Returns:
Regex to match log files to a domain on Leidos server.

datetime
Returns:

mtc_helpers.log_average_time(action_name, times)[source]¶

Logs average time for an action.

Parameters:
action_name (str):
Name of action (Download, Import, etc.)
times (list):
List of times to find the average of.
mtc_helpers.log_csv(action_name, logs, config)[source]¶

Generate csv from logs passed in.

Parameters:
action_name (string):
Action to log (Download, Import, Unzip, etc.)
logs (list of tuples):
List of log tuples to generate csv from.
config (dict):
Dictionary that holds configuration values.

Logs exception to file.

Parameters:
exception (Exception):
Exception to log.
mtc_helpers.log_import_summary(output)[source]¶

Logs output from piwik python script.

Parameters:
output (IO):
Stream from piwik command.
mtc_helpers.log_status(action_name, result, config, output=None)[source]¶

Logs whether an action for a result was Successful or Failed.

Parameters:
action_name (str):
Name of action (Download, Import, etc.)
result (tuple):
Result tuple in format: ((file_name, extract_name), status, time, key_date)
config (dict):
Dictionary that holds configuration values.
message (str) (optional):
Message to print to screen.
mtc_helpers.log_statuses(action_name, result_list, config, output)[source]¶

Logs status and average time of each result passed.

Parameters:
action_name (str):
Name of action being logged (Download, Import, etc.)
result_list (list):
List of results to log
config (dict):
Dictionary that holds configuration values.
output (str):
Output message to print to console screen.
mtc_helpers.log_time_to_file(time_name, record_time)[source]¶

Log elapsed time to file.

Parameters:
time_name (str):
Name of record’s time being recorded
record_time (time):
Time being logged
mtc_helpers.log_to_file(l_file, output)[source]¶

Log a message to given file

Parameters:
l_file (IO):
File to write message to.
output (string):
Output that goes to message.
mtc_helpers.split_lists_by_status(result_list)[source]¶

Splits a list by status of result tuples within the list.

Parameters:
result_list (list):
List of result tuples Format of tuple: ((key_name, unzipped_name), status, time, key_date)
Return type:
list
Returns:
List containing two lists, one list with successful results and the other failed results.

Writes output to stream given.

Parameters:
stream (IO):
Stream to write to.

Output to write to stream.

mtc_classes.py¶

mtc_classes.py

Author: Tyrice Clark Company: Civic Resource Group Email: tyricec@civicresource.com

class mtc_classes.Config[source]¶

Parses configuration files and checks if all required settings are present.

check_settings()[source]¶

Makes sure required settings are loaded.

read_configuration()[source]¶

Reads configuration file and stores into a dictionary.

exception mtc_classes.RequiredException(setting)[source]¶

Sets default message for exception with setting passed. Keyword arguments:

setting – The setting that wasn’t found in configuration file.
